column4: Can anyone here help me with installing these drivers? http://ipw3945.sourceforge.net/ Will running the makefile set it up for me, or will I need to use ndiswrapper?
They're native linux drivers, fyi.
ipw 1395 drivers are native for linux, it has nothing to do wth ndiswrapper.
They are also included in default kernel builds for feisty and if you isntall restricted-modules package, you will get the firmware IIRC also, so everything should work out-of-box.
How can I install that? My wireless card isn't working out of the box, I'm on a wired connection at the moment. Thanks for your help.
Would this command download the drivers?  sudo apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-2.6.20-15-generic
I just looked at the driver is in feisty's kernel (2.6.20-15-generic). The modules is called ipw3945.ko. Try running "lspci  grep Intel" and "dmesg  |grep 3945", that should tell you something
Hmm, those didn't seem to do much. Typing in the lspci brings up the standard syntax  helper screen, and the dmesg |grep command just yielded a blank screen. Any thoughts?
just type "lspci", it should list your PCI devices...?
Yep, that works. Do you want the output?
look at the line that has Intel something, that's the one we need.
!pastebin
paste it somewhere.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/23780/ Thats my lspci output, it has alot of lines with Intel in it.
there is no ipw3945 device listed, the rest of Intel is chipset. I bet the wireless device is the last one.
that device is not supported, hence you will need to do that nediswrapper hell.
The broadcom device? Hmm, it says thats what this laptop ships with...
it works well for some people though; search the web, there is plenty of ndsiwrapper and feisty howtos I bet.
they perhaps gave you different model or cheated you. But the device isn't there (almost) for sure.
Hmm, it's a Dell laptop. Anyway, is there any way I can find out the specific model of the card?
do lspci -n and look up the corresponding numbers like 12cd:de44 on the internet.
googling for broadcom 4328 (the number given by lspci) gives many results also.
